tit.e: Totsuomi no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)
tit.cmt: (government post) government postには違いないと思いますが、これだと中央官僚のようにも聞こえるので、regional governor in ancient Japan（古代日本の地域の統括者）としました。
tit.e: Totsuomi no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)

sen.j: 遠淡海国造（とおつおうみのくにみやつこ・とおつおうみこくぞう)は遠江国西部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Totsuomikuninomiyatsuko 遠淡海国造 (also known as Totsuomikokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the west part of Totomi Province.
Totsuomi kuni no miyatsuko (遠淡海国造, also known as Totsuomi kokuzo, was a kuni no miyatsuko ruled the west part of Totomi Province in ancient Japan.
Totsuomi kuni no miyatsuko (遠淡海国造), also known as Totsuomi kokuzo, was a kuni no miyatsuko ruled the west part of Totomi Province in ancient Japan.
It was also written as 遠江国造.
It was also written as 遠江国造.
It was also written as 遠江国造.
According to "Kojiki", the ancestor was Takehiratorinomikoto.
According to "Kojiki', the ancestor is Takehiratori no mikoto.
According to "Kojiki', the ancestor is Takehiratori no mikoto.

sen.j: 別名は武夷鳥命・天夷鳥命・天日照命など。
sen.e: The pseudonyms were Takehiratorinomikoto, Amenohinadorinomikoto, and Amenohinaderinomikoto.
It is also called as Takehiratori no mikoto, Amenohinadori no mikoto, and Amenohinaderi no mikoto.
sen.cmt: nomikoto --> no mikotoThe pseudonyms というほど比定がはっきりしているのかどうかよくわからないので、単に別にこうも呼ばれている、としました。武夷鳥命が別名にもあるのが謎ですがママとします。
sen.e: It is also called as Takehiratori no mikoto, Amenohinadori no mikoto, and Amenohinaderi no mikoto.
Totsuomikuninomiyatsuko was a son of Amenohohinomikoto.
Totsuomikuni no miyatsuko is a son of Amenohohi no mikoto.
Totsuomikuni no miyatsuko is a son of Amenohohi no mikoto.

sen.j: 出雲国造・武蔵国造・上菟上国造・下菟上国造・伊自牟国造などと同系。
sen.e: It was descended from the same line as Izumonokuninomiyatsuko, Musashinokuninomiyatsuko, Kamitsuunakamikuninomiyatsuko, Shimotsuunakamikuninomiyatsuko, and Ijimukuninomiyatsuko.
It was descended from the same line as Izumonokuni no miyatsuko, Musashinokuni no miyatsuko, Kamitsuunakami kuni no miyatsuko, Shimotsuunakamikuni no miyatsuko, and Ijimukuni no miyatsuko.
It was descended from the same line as Izumonokuni no miyatsuko, Musashinokuni no miyatsuko, Kamitsuunakami kuni no miyatsuko, Shimotsuunakamikuni no miyatsuko, and Ijimukuni no miyatsuko.

sen.j: ただし、『国造本紀』には物部氏の祖である伊香色雄の子の印岐美命が成務朝に遠淡海国造に任じられたとある。
sen.e: According to "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi", Ikiminomikoto, a son of Ikashikoonomikoto, who was the ancestor of the Mononobe clan, was appointed Totsuomikuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.

However, "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi" described it was Ikimi no mikoto, a son of Ikashikoo no mikoto, the founder of the Mononobe clan, who was appointed as Totsuomikuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.

However, "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi" described it was Ikimi no mikoto, a son of Ikashikoo no mikoto, the founder of the Mononobe clan, who was appointed as Totsuomikuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
The Izumo clan or the Mononobe clan.
The Izumo clan or the Mononobe clan.
The Izumo clan or the Mononobe clan.
Totomi Province.
Totomi Province.
Totomi Province.
The west part of present Shizuoka Prefecture.
The west part of present Shizuoka Prefecture.
The west part of present Shizuoka Prefecture.
Unknwon.
